history.content:
This is a reminder that the EECS deadline for DeCals is this upcoming Monday, 7/6. If you plan on offering a DeCal in Fall 2020, please follow these steps:

1. Complete the Course Proposal Form:
Visit https://decal.berkeley.edu/facilitate/start-your-own-course for detailed information about how to create a syllabus, find a faculty sponsor, and complete the Course Proposal Form (CPF).

2. Contact the EE or CS Scheduler:
Email your completed proposal to either EE Scheduler (ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu) or CS Scheduler (cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu) to discuss class scheduling and enrollment needs.

3. Submit the Proposal to the Department Chair's Assistant by July 6th:
After the CS/EE schedulers have reviewed your CPF, submit your proposal to the appropriate Department Chair's Assistant by July 6th. Late or incomplete submissions are not accepted.  

CS Dept Chair Assistant: Thomas Silva (thomassilva@eecs.berkeley.edu)
EE Dept Chair Assistant: Magali Lermigeaux (mlermigeaux@eecs.berkeley.edu)

4. Submit the Proposal to the Academic Senate for approval by July 13th:

Once you receive the Department Chair's approval, your proposal will be returned to you. You will need to submit course proposals to the Academic Senate via this link by July 13th.

The student facilitator will need to upload three separate documents to the form:

- The completed course proposal form (including the unit value worksheet). This will need to include signatures from the instructor of record and department chair. DocuSign and similar electronic signatures are acceptable.
- A fully developed syllabus

-The faculty letter of support.

Upon submitting the proposal, you will receive a copy of your responses via email, which will also allow you to sign back in and edit your responses if needed (be sure to keep a copy of that email). 

5. Academic Senate Review:
Once the Academic Senate receives the proposal, it will be reviewed for compliance with Senate policies and guidelines. Any feedback or request for corrections will be sent to the student facilitator, with a copy to the department contact. The student facilitator will be able to sign back into the Google Form and edit their previous submission by replacing the original file with a new file.  

Contact the EE Scheduler (ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu) or CS Scheduler (cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu) for questions.
